content.text: The quantities distance and time (t! = 0), when acceleration is a constant k(NOT EQUAL TO ZERO) are ___________.

solution.text:
None of the above
\(\Rightarrow\) At constant acceleration, Speed is not a constant.
\(\Rightarrow\) Therefore, distance \(\div\) time = constant(k)
\(\Rightarrow\) Hence, it is not directly proportional.
